result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernadene A Cook

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on February 2, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

Defendant Bernadene A Cook in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Bernadene A Cook. Called @ 2:35 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea hearing on all cases - 21CF24, 21CF276, 22CF30. Record by Atty. Renz as to the limited agreement. Court addresses the State as to need for PSI - criminal history. Atty. Renz provides the Court with prior conviction for DC and OWI. Atty. TenHaken responds to victim's rights. They are in compliance.
Court goes over maximum penalties, deportation and firearms warning.
Defendant responds to Court's questions regarding plea questionnaire. 
Atty. Renz responds to Court's questions regarding entry of plea and stipulation to facts
Defendant enters the following pleas:
21-CF-24 - GUILTY COUNT #1
21-CF-276 - GUILTY COUNT #1
22-CF-30 - GUILTY COUNT #3
ALL REMAINING COUNTS ARE DISMISSED AND READ IN.
Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and finds the defendant guilty.
2:44 p.m. - Court addresses State as to criminal record - Response/record by Atty. TenHaken. Further discussion as to probability of prison argument.
Based upon the discussion, Court will order the psi. Matter set for sentencing before the assigned Judge - Hon. Kristine Drettwan. Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bernadene A Cook in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Bernadene A Cook. Called @ 3:29 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pre-trial on both files - 21CF242 and 21CF276. Case 22CF30 is tracking these matters.  Record by the State that drug results are in and State is ready to proceed. Record by Atty. Renz who confirms defense is ready to go, but her client wanted her to request adjournment so she could get into treatment to maybe procure better offer from the State. Nothing has been scheduled as far as treatment. Response by the State. Trial remains on for now, but will allow Atty. Renz to speak with ADA Herrmann. Atty. Renz must inform the Court by Friday if agreement is reached. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Bernadene A Cook appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Bernadene A Cook.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:06 pm. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status on all files - 21CF242, 21CF276, 22CF30. Record by Atty. Renz that matter is still poised for trial as previously scheduled. Bond motion filed is withdrawn as bond was posted. Defendant in custody until May 25th on traffic citations. Parties have nothing further.  Trial dates remain on as scheduled. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Motion hearing on March 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bernadene A Cook appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Ashley L Renz appeared in court for Bernadene A Cook, Attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:36 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 8th status on 21CF242, 6th status on 21CF276, and 1st status on 22CF30. Record by Atty. Renz who asks for additional status and bond motion hearing. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Motion hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

02:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Bernadene A Cook in court, in custody with attorney Birch in court for attorney Ashley L Renz. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bernadene A Cook appeared by video means.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Birch acknowledges the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of her client.




adj 2:03 PM
Ashley Renz

Defendant Bernadene A Cook in court, in custody via video with attorney Ashley L Renz.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance, complaint read by atty Renz, charges/penalties explained.  Preliminary heraing rights given & hearing requested within time period.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 22GF56, 21CF276 & 21CF242
DEFENANT MUST POST $1,000.00 CASH  
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH N.O.C.O (dob 8/24/2004) OR RESIDENCE.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-187 thru 22-189
see signature bond for conditions

Defendant Bernadene Allen Cook in court in custody via video with attorney Leah Birch for attorney Ashley Renz.  Samuel Berg for State of Wisconsin.    Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Motion to modify bond by atty Birch.  State objects to modifying weekend bond.  Minutes filed.
Notice of Arrest
